title: Carlo's Bakery opening in The Woodlands tainted by disorganization

Photo: Contributed Photo Carlo's Bakery opening in The Woodlands tainted by disorganization 1 / 25 Back to Gallery 
Buddy Valastro's highly-anticipated Carlo's Bakery made it's Houston-area debut at the Woodlands Mall on Saturday, Feb. 18, but things did not go as planned for many of the fans waiting to get a taste of the famous pastries. 
The bakery opened its proverbial doors at 8:30 a.m., but hopeful locals had been lined up since the wee hours of the morning waiting for a chance to meet the celebrity baker. 
PREPPING FOR MARDI GRAS: Everything you need to know about the traditional King Cake 
However, the celebration quickly turned sour as the crowds grew and mall security saw themselves in a bind. 
For some the wait simply became too long and they left, but others who had been waiting for hours on on end were turned away and told they could not visit the bakery, according to comments on the new bakery's Facebook page. 
(Story continues below) 
Lobster tails are going to be the new cannoli. Media: MediaOS Video 
"So disappointed with the way this was handled. I understand this is the mall's fault but still frustrating for someone who drove an hour and half and then stood in line for two hours only to be told that we couldn't get in" said one commentor . 
Another commentor posted "we waited 4 hours and didn't get to see this! We showed up at 4:50am and the mall security ruined it for my girls! Makes me so sad! 
The comments kept pouring in blaming the mall and security for ruining the event for thousands of people who showed up for the opening. 
Luckily the bakery is here to stay, so hopefully those who missed their chance will still be able to get their hands on an infamous cannoli. Neighborhood News
